intro: Cliffortia arachnoidea, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, intricate flower structure. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small, often pale green or yellowish, and are adorned with fine, hair-like structures that resemble spider legs, giving it its common name. Cliffortia arachnoidea is a perennial herb that produces showy, fragrant blooms during the cooler months.
